title: Saturday Studio: Fresh Cuts (Apr 15)
hero_caption: Gio Swaby. New Growth Second Chapter 11, 2021. Collection of the Altman Family © Gio Swaby.
short_description: Inspired by the vibrant textile portraits created by contemporary artist Gio Swaby, participants will make their own collaged portraits celebrating the identity of their chosen subject. The program will be led by artist and educator Danielle Wright.
list_description: Inspired by the vibrant textile portraits created by contemporary artist Gio Swaby, participants will make their own collaged portraits celebrating the identity of their chosen subject. The program will be led by artist and educator Danielle Wright.
description:
How would you describe an individual using only images, shapes, and color? Inspired by the vibrant textile portraits created by contemporary artist Gio Swaby, participants are invited to make their own collaged portraits combining textures, patterns, and colors to celebrate the identities of their chosen subject. This program is led by artist and educator Danielle Wright.

Saturday Studio is an art-making experience in the galleries led by Chicago-based artists that welcomes participants of all experience levels. The program is free with admission, and all materials are provided.

If you have any questions about programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
